revised_title: Molecular Volume and Gas Compressibilities: A Study of Non-Polar Gases
tldr: The author investigates the compressibilities and expansion coefficients of non-polar gases at low pressures and their relation to molecular volume. They propose a method to express these properties in terms of effective molecular volume and find that compressibilities and expansion coefficients are linear functions of molecular volume for non-polar gases. The study also highlights the differences in behavior between non-polar and polar gases.
